intro: Bollea patinii, commonly known as the Patin's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Bollea patinii has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers during the spring and summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
